title: UPDATED "50 STATES OF RECYCLING" ASSESSMENT FINDS THAT WELL-DESIGNED POLICY IS CRITICAL TO ... - PR Newswire
summary: A new report by Eunomia Research & Consulting and Ball Corporation highlights the need for more accurate data, policy and infrastructure investment to improve recycling rates in the United States. The report found that states with Recycling Refunds (bottle bills or Deposit Return Systems) have significantly higher recycling rates than states without them. The report also found that a combination of Recycling Refunds and Extended Producer Responsibility policies can lead to even higher recycling rates and greater economic benefits.

business_innovation: TRUE, the report discusses the economic benefits of recycling, including job creation and increased economic activity.

green_process: TRUE, the report discusses the environmental benefits of recycling, which can lead to the development of green processes that reduce waste and conserve resources.

title: OP/ED: Mercy University's Recycling System – The Impact - The Impact
summary: Mercy University has a poor recycling system and lacks eco-friendly materials in both the Main Hall cafeteria and Victory Hall. The author proposes implementing a simple recycling system with rewards to incentivize students to recycle. Additionally, the author suggests that Mercy University could become a leader in sustainability and environmental consciousness by implementing an effective recycling program.

title: BWH Hotels and Call2Recycle Bring Battery Recycling Practices to the Canadian Hospitality Sector - GlobeNewswire
summary: Call2Recycle, a Canadian battery collection and recycling program, and BWH Hotels, a leading global hospitality enterprise, are collaborating to implement battery recycling across the BWH network. This is the first time a major company in the Canadian hospitality sector has integrated battery recycling on a large scale as part of their sustainability strategy. BWH Hotels is a leading, global hospitality enterprise comprised of three hotel companies, including WorldHotels, Best Western Hotels & Resorts and SureStay Hotels. The global enterprise boasts approximately 4,300 hotels in over 100 countries and territories worldwide.
green_innovation: TRUE; The initiative is part of BWH’s global “Because We Care” sustainability program, which is aimed at increasing sustainable practices and reducing the carbon footprint across the hotel network.
business_innovation: TRUE; The article describes the implementation of a battery recycling program across the BWH network, which is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE; The article does not describe a new or improved good or service that differs significantly from the firm’s previous goods or services and that has been introduced on the market.
green_process: TRUE; The article describes the implementation of a battery recycling program across the BWH network, which is a new or improved business process for one or more business functions that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.

title: Four Michigan tribes get federal grant dollars for recycling projects - MLive.com
summary: Four Michigan tribes received a total of $5.6 million in federal grants to improve recycling and composting facilities, as well as for recycling education efforts. The grants will be used to build new facilities and upgrade existing ones, as well as to purchase new equipment. The Michigan Recycling Coalition will use its grant to educate the public about recycling and composting.

title: Updated U.S. recycling report finds $6.5 billion worth of material lost to landfill annually - Recycling Product News
summary: Recycling refund programs significantly increase recycling rates and promote closed-loop end markets, leading to economic, environmental, and social benefits. The 50 States of Recycling report highlights disparities in recycling rates, with top-performing states implementing recycling refunds and extended producer responsibility policies. The report emphasizes the need for effective recycling policies and infrastructure to transition to a circular economy.

title: How did the top smartphone makers fare in sustainability in 2023? - Rappler
summary: The article discusses the environmental impact of smartphone production and use, and the sustainability efforts of major smartphone manufacturers like Apple, Samsung, Xiaomi, and others. The article also highlights the growing consumer demand for sustainable products and the regulatory efforts underway to promote sustainability in the smartphone industry. The article concludes that while the smartphone industry's impact on the environment is significant, the initiatives being taken by companies and governments have the potential to turn the smartphone value chain green.

title: Elfbar's pop-up event shines spotlight on responsible recycling for single-use vapes - Convenience Store
summary: Elf Bar, a vape brand, is promoting a recycling program called GreenAwareness to address the issue of single-use vape waste. The program provides free recycling bins to retail and convenience stores, and the company is working to develop a conceptual single-use vape that is easier to dismantle for recycling.

business_innovation: TRUE, the GreenAwareness program is a business innovation because it is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE, the conceptual single-use vape that Elf Bar is developing is a green product because it is designed to be more easily dismantled for recycling.
green_process: TRUE, the recycling process for single-use vapes that Elf Bar is developing is a green process because it aims to reduce waste, conserve natural resources, and limit the release of harmful substances into the environment.
